subPoints: Good use of Pandas.
cleaning data - good use of Pandas functions to do this
plotting - good, concise coding for the plot generation
plotting - well formatted plots (e.g., axis labels, fontsize, color)
delimiter (i.e., `sep`) - incorrectly specified the separator used within the CSV-formatted file
header (i.e., `header`) - incorrectly specified the header line
input data - incorrectly read in the data
input file - renaming the input data file is very poor practice
input file path - hard coding your local folder structure for the input file path results in problems, requiring the user to edit your notebook.
cleaning - the data was not cleaned properly (e.g., `drop_duplicates`,  `dropna` or `drop`)
saving - the cleaned data was not saved (e.g., using `inplace` or assigning it to a new object)

negative.mainPoint: Displaying a dataframe as a table
subPoints: A dataframe in a Jupyter-notebook should be displayed by either using the dataframe's name by itself, or using `display`.
Printing a dataframe does not make use Jupyter-notebook's capability of displaying an easily readable table.
Converting the data units was incorrectly done.
A user-defined function to covert the units would have been logical to do, as demonstrated in a previous solution key.
One should use as many decimal in the conversion factor as possible (e.g., 2625.4996394799), rather than rounding to a few decimal places.
axis labels - the plots do not have proper axes labels
axis labels - units were not included in the axis label(s) (e.g., kJ/mol, Angstrom)
data - the data plotted should have all the same units (e.g., kJ/mol)
fontsize - the choice of fontsize(s) could have been better
legend - the plot does not include a legend
library - the plotting was not done using only the Pandas' library
plot(s) - the plots were not shown due to errors
not saved - none of the final data was not saved
not saved - some required data was not saved

negative.mainPoint: The following was wrong with the equations
subPoints: the Lennard-Jones equation was incorrectly encoded
the Lennard-Jones equation's parameters were incorrectly specified
the exponential equation was incorrectly encoded
the exponential equation's parameters were incorrectly specified
The generated numeric data were wrong.
The solutions were not given with the correct units.
